story:
This is an ambitious project and a Once-in-a-Lifetime Opportunity. 

We need your help to make it happen!

100 years before WW1, another pivotal event occurred in European history... Waterloo. Please help us to honour a famous Scottish Cavalry Regiment, whose courage and sacrifice were crucial to the outcome of the battle that shaped Europe for a century. Surplus funds will go to two charities, helping members of today's British Forces and their families. 

GREYS & GLORY    1815 - Waterloo - 2015

The 18th June 2015 will mark the 200th Anniversary of the Battle of Waterloo. This was the decisive, bloody and muddy battle that brought an end to Napoleon’s campaign and saw no less than 45000 casualties in the first 12 hours of conflict.

To commemorate the battle, a large re-enactment takes place on the original battlefield every 5 years. The bicentennial re-enactment in 2015 will be massive. 5000 participants, consisting of 4500 infantry, 300 cavalry and 100 canon, will perform to over 120,000 live spectators and millions of TV viewers worldwide. 

The ROYAL SCOTS GREYS made a series of momentous cavalry charges that fateful day in 1815, including the most famous charge as part of the Union Brigade, turning back 20,000 of Napoleon’s infantry.

Despite their valiant and historic role in the battle, The Greys, who also captured one of Napoleon’s prized eagle-standards and suffered major casualties, have not, until now, been represented at these re-enactments. The absence of The Greys at the bicentennial commemoration is unimaginable.

In association with THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS (formerly THE ROYAL SCOTS GREYS) and the Regiment's Waterloo 200 committee, The War Horse Foundation is spearheading the project GREYS & GLORY. 

We are Fritz Bronner, Director of the War Horse Foundation in Los Angeles, and Jonathan Findlay, former Captain of The Royal Scots Dragoon Guards.

Our aim is to source enough riders, horses, period uniforms, logistical support and funds to guarantee the representation of The Royal Scots Greys on the original battlefield at the bicentennial commemorations and re-enactment at Waterloo in Belgium (17-21 June 2015).

While remembering the past, we wish to also recognise the present; after we have covered our logistical and administrative costs, surplus funds raised will go to our chosen charities: ABF The Soldiers' Charity and Scotty's Little Soldiers.

The Army Benevolent Fund (now The Soldiers' Charity) is a charity-trust that assists British veterans and their families. Scotty's Little Soldiers is a charity-trust focused on the children of military veterans who have fallen in their country's service.  These are  the equivalent of the Wounded Warriors and other like-minded VETERAN SUPPORT projects in America. This is a chance to help and say thank you for their service and sacrifice.

WHAT WE NEED

We hope to field up to 20 horses and riders on the day, but all their logistical and administrative costs need to be covered.

We hope to raise at least £150,000 (£5000 per horse and rider + taxes, charges and contingency) beyond which all surplus funds will benefit our chosen charities.

All donations, large or small, will bring us closer to achieving our goal and to helping our chosen charities.

There are also other ways in which you can help.

You can contribute more than money...

· Please get the word out, sound the trumpets and make some noise about our GREYS & GLORY campaign.

· Please use the Indiegogo share tools to share with your friends!

· If you have or know someone in the UK or Europe who has suitable, fit & trained, grey horses that can be loaned or lent to us, please let us know. 

· If you have some spare frequent flyer air-miles, these will help defray costs and assist in bringing the administrative team together for planning and coordination meetings and training sessions for the troops. 

· If you have British tack and saddles and can loan, lend or donate the gear to our campaign. 

· If you have ideas and suggestions, please contact us!

CORPORATE SPONSORSHIP

If you are part of a corporation and wish to help sponsor our campaign, we would be delighted to discuss our sponsorship solutions with you and will do our best to tailor the benefits to your budget and expectations. Please contact us via our website www.greysandglory.org. 

DONATIONS

Donations can be made via PayPal on this site. You don't however need a Paypal account.

Donations will be collected by The War Horse and Militaria Heritage Foundation and, after logistical and administrative costs have been covered, surplus funds will be paid to our chosen charities. Donations by US citizens in the US are 100% tax- deductible to a 501-c3 non-profit that is fulfilling its educational mission.  The mission of the War Horse & Militaria Heritage Foundation (War Horse Foundation) is to educate the public of the contribution that horses have made in military history. 

For the past 15 years, War Horse Foundation has been presenting the GREYS in Parade Dress in California at festivals and cultural events, including four times in the Tournament of Roses Parade. 


Now, with THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS, we hope to  go to Waterloo and present the battle-campaign dress of the of the ROYAL SCOTS GREYS.  Some of our existing uniforms can be used, but others will need to be made from scratch, along with new gear and equipment and it all has to be shipped over to Belgium. PLEASE NOTE- we are not taking our horses over, due to expense and the stress this would cause to the horses.  We will therefore need to borrow or rent horses locally. 

With active and former officers of THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS and the support of the Regiment's Waterloo 200 Committee, we are all working together to build this project. 

Please take a moment or two to view the following series of videos we have prepared for this campaign. For those of you who wish to know more, additional information can also be found below or on our website www.greysandglory.org.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR VALUABLE SUPPORT!

Warm regards,

Jonathan Findlay & Fritz Bronner

_______________________________________________________________________

A FEW WORDS.... From the Commanding Officer of THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS

"It is an honour to introduce GREYS & GLORY which commemorates the bicentenary of the Battle of Waterloo, at which our regimental forebears fought.....The re-enactment of the battle on the 200th anniversary, offers us an opportunity to continue this legacy....This momentous event that will see the charge of the GREYS alongside some five thousand international re-enactors cannot occur without the hard work, sponsorship and support of many. 

I earnestly request your support to this important effort. the logistical challenge is considerable but one that must embraced with vigour and enthusiasm.

Proceeds that are raised beyond the costs....will go to the ABF: The Soldier's Charity, who help thousands of beneficiaries whenever they are in need including those serving and their families."

- Lt Colonel Ben J. Cattermole MBE

  Commanding Officer, THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS

_______________________________________________________________________

The Royal Scots Dragoon Guards

Home Headquarters, The Castle, Edinburgh EHI 2YI

October 2014

I was commissioned into The Royal Scots Greys in 1965 on the 150th Anniversary of Waterloo -- now 50 years on, the importance of the Victory at the Battle of Waterloo is un-diminished. 

This coming year we commemorate the 200th Anniversary of The Battle of Waterloo. For our Regiment, now known as The Royal Scots Dragoon Guards, Waterloo remains our main Battle Honour and The Eagle of the 45th French Infantry is still proudly worn as our cap badge. The treasured Eagle Standard captured by Sergeant Ewart is displayed in our Edinburgh Castle Museum, reminding us all of that famous Charge of the Union Brigade and sadly the 189 Regimental Soldiers who bravely gave their lives for King and Country. Their extraordinary courage continues to inspire the modern day Troopers who willingly risk their lives in the interests of World Peace, in the many challenging operational situations of today. 

My Waterloo 200 Committee fully supports The GREYS & GLORY initiative championed by the War Horse Foundation, to pay formal tribute to those who fell at Waterloo. "

Brigadier Melville S. Jameson, Chairman Waterloo 200 Committee

____________________________________________________________________

"The Greys and Glory ride at Waterloo 200 should be a once in a lifetime opportunity to take recreate military history.  Profits from the ride will go towards charity.  ABF The Soldiers’ Charity (originally the Army Benevolent Fund, since creation in 1944) is the national charity of the British Army.  The charity looks after all soldiers, veterans (young and old) and their families when in need.  Our youngest beneficiary is a 5-month old child, the oldest a 107-year-old widow of a veteran.  Whether a soldier from World War Two, Korea, the Falklands, Northern Ireland, Iraq of Afghanistan (and many other campaigns besides), the Army’s charity provides the backbone of support typically to over 5000 individuals and families annually. No two families or situations are the same, but to those concerned the charity’s help can be little short of life-changing.  Poignantly, amongst these ranks are of course regimental descendants of Waterloo’s Scots Greys – today’s Royal Scots Dragoon Guards.

Thank you for your donation to Greys and Glory.  Any profits from the ride will go towards charity, which will allow us to help soldiers, veterans and families from World War Two to recent conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan.

Good luck to all the riders taking part at Waterloo 200!”

Charles Dunphie, Regional Director Scotland, ABF The Soldiers' Charity

______________________________________________________________________

WHERE WILL THE FUNDS BE SPENT?

Your support of Greys & Glory will help and assist us in finding suitable grey horses to participate at the Waterloo commemorations, manufacture additional uniforms and bearskins caps of the era, gauntlets, equipment and accoutrements for horse and rider.  

Some items we have in stock and needs fluffing and repairs while many others will need to be manufactured.  

Relive the charge of the Greys! 

The horses will need to be transported from around Western Europe to Belgium, cared for, fed and trained as a unit. 

We have ambitious goals and with your help we hope we can present up to 30 Royal Scots Greys as they were in 1815 and participate in the five days at Waterloo 200.


What We Need & What You Get

We need these funds to secure suitable grey horses from the local region of Scotland, England, Wales, France, Germany, Belgium and or Holland, to train, drill, and transport to Waterloo, Belgium.  These horses will be privately owned, loaned or rented. They will need medical clearances by Veterinarians with proper certification clearances to cross borders in order to be at Waterloo 2015. All of the horses will need to be transported to Waterloo several days before the event, boarded and cared for. Horses need constant support personnel to be exercised, groomed and trained. This support involves grooms and extra hands to make sure the horses are always safe.

For You as a Donor!

By contributing to GREYS & GLORY, we have some amazing and unique PERKS with special access to functions at the higher levels. Please explore our PERK LIST below for more details.

Two hundred years ago, individuals founded and funded cavalry regiments. Cavalry regiments were historically pricier than infantry regiments, and they still are today. Officers back then, purchased their rank, and these funds helped pay for the regiment. We are hoping that you can help raise the 1815 ROYAL SCOTS GREYS this same way. By your level of donation, you are "purchasing" your honorary rank as part of the 1815 ROYAL SCOTS GREYS.  Your name will be listed in the DONOR RANK LIST under your level of donation. The list will be displayed in highest rank to lowest rank. 

We will be operating a Prize Draw, into which the names of all donors, received both on and off line and including those who wish to remain anonymous, will be entered, however the Terms and Conditions of Indiegogo do not allow for the details to be hosted on this campaign page. Please therefore refer to our website www.greysandglory.org for details.                                                                                               -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Impact YOU will make with your contribution.

Your contribution will make this campaign possible and help build 1815 era ROYAL SCOTS GREYS into a mounted unit, similar to how they were when they made their famous charge at Waterloo.  

This is the first time in history (200 years!) to see the 1815 ROYAL SCOTS GREYS thundering again on the battlefield of Waterloo! You will make this iconic image part commemoration, memorial, part visual poetry and recognition of this British cavalry charge.

US donations is 100% tax- deductible to a 501-c3 non-profit that is fulfilling its educational mission.  The War Horse & Militaria Heritage Foundation (War Horse Foundation) mission is to educate the public of the contribution that horses made in military history. 

  • Your contribution and assistance will rebuild the grandeur of the ROYAL SCOTS GREYS as a mounted cavalry unit again! 
  • Let's make Britain and Scotland proud by remembering the GREYS, and their noble deeds!
  • Veterans of the GREYS and THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS will be present, honoured and thanked at a commemoration.
  • It will be the first time in 200 years that the GREYS have been at Waterloo! 
  • This is a once in a lifetime campaign! The 200th Anniversary only comes once! Here is a chance to show this to the WORLD!
  • Your support will allow us to bring this noble British cavalry regiment back to the fields of Waterloo in front of hundreds of thousands of spectators for the first time!
  • The combination of THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS, retired members of the regiment and the War Horse Foundation, brings an experienced team together.
  • Surplus funds, will go to two wonderful charity-trusts benefiting military veterans and their families, that are in need.                                                                ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Risks & Challenges

How can we possibly rebuild a cavalry regiment from two hundred years ago?

We have cavalry experience and many have military experience from their time in THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS along with discipline and training.  The War Horse Foundation has been presenting cavalry regiments and blending horses, riders and uniforms for 15 years. The Foundation has appeared in over 150 parades, as well as festivals, civic events and 25 schools.

All of the riders joining the GREYS & GLORY campaign, are experienced riders, however we plan to hold training days for the horses and riders to prepare for the event. 

War Horse trains every week as a mounted unit. Several of the former officers of THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS regularly ride and many have their own horses as well. Together, with our combined experience we should be able to quickly create a cohesive unit.

We will make our best efforts to achieve our goals, but if we do not have the full financial resources available, we will have to scale our scope of the  project. Other risks include weather, force-majeure or unforeseen obstacles or decisions made by the organisers of the event which could alter or curtail our plans. We also are working with horses that have natural inherent risks and potential unpredictable reactions to stimulus. All the donations are non refundable and will be spent on program costs with surplus amounts going to the designated charities.

This is a lifetime dream for many of us; to present and share the 1815 ROYAL SCOTS GREYS and commemorate the valour and sacrifice by this regiment at Waterloo. We are honoured to present the GREYS for the first time in 200 years at Waterloo and hopefully at events in the UK as well. 

How your donations will be applied.......

The majority of the funds will go to finding quality grey horses, suitable for the ceremony, presentations and the battle reenactment at Waterloo. This includes rental of the horses, insurance, transportation, feed, box stalls, vet care, shoeing, grooms, health inspections, equine documentation, tack, equipment, shipping. We also need to cover the cost of tentage, food for the teams, travel, transportation of equipment , insurance and uniforms. We already have a dozen Scots Grey 1815 uniforms which we have been using for fifteen years. Some of these will need some refurbishing and we will need additional uniforms to ensure that all riders are kitted out. Additional bearskin caps, weather covers for bearskins, campaign breeches, accoutrements, extra bearskins, should straps and pouches. We also will have horse trailer transport trucks & drivers, ground crew and support team to take care of and their sustenance to cover.

All surplus funds, after administrative and logistical costs have been covered, will go 80% to ABF The Soldiers' Charity and 20%  Scotty's Little Soldiers.

FUNDING BREAKDOWN AVERAGE 

(above the BASE Tier 1 amount)

Categories - Left to Right

29%    HORSE - lease,Vet, Insurance, transportation, feed, tack, groom supplies etc

17%.    UNIFORMS & EQUIPMENT - manufacture, purchase, rentals & repairs

11%     PERSONNEL  - Rider, Crew, Drivers, transportation, insurance, sustenance

 3%.     INSURANCE - Public, Humans, Horses & Equipment

 9%.     ADMINISTRATION  - Fees, Overhead, Accounting, Hired Labour

11%.    DONATION PERKS , S&H

16%.     DONATION - ABF  (80%) and Scotty's Little Soldiers (20%)

  4%.     CONTINGENCY

CLOCKWISE LISTING:

29%    HORSE - leases, Veterinarian,  insurance (equine medical), transportation, feed, tack, groom supplies etc

17%.    UNIFORMS & EQUIPMENT - manufacture, purchase, rentals & repairs

11%     PERSONNEL  - Rider, Crew, Drivers, transportation, insurance, sustenance

 3%.     INSURANCE - Public, Humans, Horses & Equipment

 9%.     ADMINISTRATION  - Fees, Overhead, Accounting, Hired Labour

11%.    DONATION PERKS , S&H

16%.     TARGETED CHARITY DONATIONS

  4%.     CONTINGENCY 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Who is Riding?

Several retired officers from the regiment, enthusiasts and a group from the War Horse Foundation. We recruit experienced riders who need to handle a variety of situations with horses. We have men and women regularly train and  ride in the troop. All of the women that ride with us, hide their gender to appear as male troopers; just as the famous Mother Ross did with the Scots Greys one hundred years before Waterloo. THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS are very proud of the history and heritage of Mother Ross's exploits in battle as a SCOTS GREY and proudly recognise her in the regimental histories. The Regiment also recognises the value of diversity in the military today and the  Mother Ross's that may serve in the military today and in the future.

The riders are mostly based in the US & UK, but several are living throughout Europe as well. There is a shared knowledge overlap of the training and skills needed for this campaign.

What if you do not raise the full amount? 

Any amount of funding will help us in our goals in even a small way. We are determined to go to Waterloo, even with just a small footprint. There has never been a SCOTS GREY riding on the fields of Waterloo since the famous battle... Ideally we can make a proper presentation, worthy of the accomplishments of the ROYAL SCOTS GREYS.  We have already spent hundreds of hours planning this journey and are determined to give honour to the regiment. 

Once we have covered our logistical and administrative costs, any remaining funds left over will go to ABF The Soldiers' Charity & Scotty's Little Soldiers.

_____________________________________________________________________________

- A message from Fritz

"The British have been our most valued friend and  ally, thru thick and thin... Here is a chance to recognise this by commemorating and celebrating the heritage of the GREYS for this auspicious ceremony and helping out British veterans and their families. All surplus funds will go to the ABF The Soldiers' Charity and Scotty's Little Soldiers.

This is a fantastic program for veterans and their families... Here is a chance for Americans to say thank you!

I can not tell you how much of a privilege and honour it is to be part of this endeavour. It is a once in a life time experience and we are hoping you will join and help us with any size of donation. Through your support we can take this journey together as we post images, videos and accounts of this fantastic series of commemorations of the ROYAL SCOTS GREYS."

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

- A message from Jonathan

"I served in the Regiment over 20 years ago, as a Captain and Squadron Second-in-Command. And what an amazing Regiment in which to serve! Scotland's senior Regiment; Scotland's only cavalry Regiment; the Regiment's Colonel-in-Chief is none other than Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II; the Regiment boasts one of the most impressive lists of battle honours of all British Regiments; even the Pipes and Drums of The Royal Scots Dragoon Guards have achieved worldwide fame, winning numerous awards and holding the N°1 spot in the UK music charts for weeks on end! Everything about the Regiment breathes professionalism, courage, tradition and accomplishment. It truly is a Regiment which is Second to None.

However, you would have thought that, with so many accolades, the Regiment could afford to field its own troops at the Waterloo reenactment, but this is sadly not the case. The Regiment may have been one of the lucky few to have survived the recent volley of amalgamations and disbandments, but it has been equally hit by the cut-backs, both in terms of budget and autonomy. The World is getting smaller and the changing threat calls for changing roles and tactics. Already the Regiment is downsizing from Challenger II tanks to light armoured vehicles and there is no guarantee that The Royal Scots Dragoon Guards will remain untouched and intact should another round of defence cuts scythe through centuries of history and tradition. 

Ironically, the Regiment's conversion to lighter vehicles and its move back to Scotland both coincide with the bicentenary of Waterloo, the Regiment's most famous battle honour – another reason why the Regiment is counting upon us to represent The Greys at the Waterloo in 2015. And we are counting upon you to help us make it happen!Greys and Glory is much more than just a handful of riders dressing up and playing soldiers for a day or two. It is the opportunity to showcase the Regiment at a key moment in its history, to educate the audience and to pay tribute to those who courageously and selflessly risked their lives on the battlefield, many of whom paid the ultimate price. 

My ancestor, James Wemyss, led his troop in the final charge of the Greys at Waterloo. Wounded in the arm and having taken musket fire and had two horses shot from beneath him, he wrote a letter from the battlefield to his sisters in Edinburgh, informing them of the victory and of the severe losses suffered by the Regiment. Of the initial 400 cavalry, he writes that only 26 remained on the field to the last. This may be close to the figure we manage to field on the day. Admittedly a lot less than the original 400, but at least it will be something. In fact, it will be more than something – it will be a major accomplishment! 

The Greys not being represented at the bicentenary re-enactment is unimaginable. It is a once in a lifetime opportunity. Please help us to make it happen!"

Other Ways You Can Help

You can contribute more than money...

  • Please get the word out, sound the trumpets and make some noise about our GREYS & GLORY campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to share with your friends!
  • If you have or know someone in the UK or Europe who has suitable, fit & trained,  grey horses that can be loaned to us, please let us know. 
  • If you have frequent flyer airline  miles,  this will help defray costs and  assist in bringing the administrative team together for planning and coordination meetings and training sessions for the troops. 
  • If you have British tack and saddles and can loan or donate the gear to our campaign. 
  • If you have ideas and suggestions, please contact us!

CORPORATE SPONSORSHIP

  • If you are part of a corporation and wish to help sponsor our campaign, we have a special corporate marketing package we would like to send you and would be delighted to discuss details, benefits and the level of sponsorship. Please contact us via our website www.greysandglory.org. 
WATERLOO - the 1970s film. 

The impressive film footage you are seeing is from the 1970s film, WATERLOO, staring Rod Steigert & Christopher Plummer.  With the producers heirs' gracious permission and in association with THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS, we can give you an impression of what THE ROYAL SCOTS GREYS would have looked like. While greatly appreciated and entertaining to watch this charge, there are some inaccuracies and inconsistencies of The GREYS' charge as it was presented in the film, and this will give us the chance to educate at WATERLOO 2015 by sharing the the actual details of what really happened two hundred years ago. 

The GREYS and the UNION BRIGADE actually charged, a massive column of thousands  of French infantry.  The French suffered hundreds if casualties and two-three thousand were captured as prisoners. This clash of cavalry and infantry would have proved far too costly for the movie production,  so it was dropped completely. During the charge many  of the GREYS probably wore weather covers on their bearskins. The GREYS continued the charge and successfully overran the French artillery. The GREYS also completed  four or five additional charges later that day which contributed to the attrition of both troopers and horses.  None of this was covered in the film nor is it ever mentioned in most historical books. 


PERKS

We have designed some unique GREYS & GLORY  donation gifts for you and for your kind support!

REFRIGERATOR MAGNET -  Shades of Greys is our first design. We will have several additional designs and will announce this on our blog in the near future.

BOOKMARK -  Share the passion of the GREYS & GLORY Campaign. 

POSTCARD - CARD , There will be several designs and it will either be a postcard or a card w/ envelope, (photo shows card with envelope)

POSTER - We will have several designs of posters of artwork of the 1815 GREYS.

COFFEE MUG - TEA MUG - we have several designs of 1815 era SCOTS GREYS for your support and enjoyment

CANVAS ART PRINT, signed by the digital artist. We have several beautiful art canvas prints of the 1815 era SCOTS GREYS.  These are unique gifts designed for this campaign and your support. 

LONG SLEEVE SHIRT- This comes in one size, LARGE.  It will display proudly the 1815 SCOTS GREYS and the GREYS & GLORY CAMPAIGN.  Wear it proud and show your support!

COFFEE TABLE BOOK - This is a War Horse Foundation, Coffee Table book sharing the history of the horse in war. It displays many famous cavalry regiments, including THE ROYAL SCOTS GREYS.

1815 ROYAL SCOTS GREY PLUSH TOY - This is a unique one of a kind soft toy of a trooper and grey horse, ready to be named and displayed in your home and to share with youngsters. 

KEY FOB - This will be a GREYS & GLORY designed Key Fob to share the memories of The GREYS for years to come.

SCOTS GREY, TROOPER'S FORAGE CAP (Reproduction)- This is a Trooper's Cap designed for camp life, worn the night before the battle. This will come in one size, for an adult, approximately size 58-59, or US 7 to 7- 1/4.

SCOTS GREY OFFICER BICORN HAT (Reproduction) - This is an Officer's Bicorn Hat, worn for all duties and carrying the rank of a senior officer in the 1815 era. This will come in one size, for an adult, being approximately 58-59, 7 to  7-1/4.

CRYSTAL DECANTER - Special Edition Gift Items commissioned by The Royal Scots Dragoon Guards to commemorate the Waterloo Bicentenary and The Greys.


STRETCH GOALS -------

This campaign of GREYS & GLORY is really Phase Two of the funding needed. 

If we can reach these funds now, on this campaign, it will allow us to have two troops or more!

If we can obtain these stretch goals now, it will allow better efficiency of the funds, especially in procuring the horses on a group rate and with transportation along with deposits etc. 

Most importantly, the more funds we raise, the higher the percentage that also goes to ABF The Soldiers' Charity & Scotty's Little Soldiers.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Bicentenary Re-enactment and Commemorations are in full preparation and the organisers have launched a number of trailers and teaser videos:

Thank you for your interest and visiting our campaign and we hope with your contribution, you can raise a glass and help raise a troop, a troop of SCOTS GREYS!

story_txt:
This is an ambitious project and a Once-in-a-Lifetime Opportunity. 
We need your help to
make it happen!

100 years before WW1, another pivotal event occurred in European history... Waterloo. Please help us to honour a famous Scottish Cavalry Regiment, whose courage and sacrifice were crucial to the outcome of the battle that shaped Europe for a century. Surplus funds will go to two charities, helping members of today's British Forces and their families. 
GREYS & GLORY    1815 - Waterloo - 2015The 18th June 2015 will mark the 200th Anniversary of the Battle of Waterloo. This was the decisive, bloody and muddy battle that brought an end to Napoleon’s campaign and saw no less than 45000 casualties in the first 12 hours of conflict. To commemorate the battle, a large re-enactment takes place on the original battlefield every 5 years. The bicentennial re-enactment in 2015 will be massive.  5000 participants, consisting of 4500 infantry, 300 cavalry and 100 canon, will perform to over 120,000 live spectators and millions of TV viewers worldwide.  
The ROYAL SCOTS GREYS made a series of momentous cavalry charges that fateful day in 1815, including the most famous charge as part of the Union Brigade, turning back 20,000 of Napoleon’s infantry.Despite their valiant and historic role in the battle, The Greys, who also captured one of Napoleon’s prized eagle-standards and suffered major casualties, have not, until now, been represented at these re-enactments. The absence of The Greys at the bicentennial commemoration is unimaginable.
In association with THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS (formerly THE ROYAL SCOTS GREYS) and the Regiment's Waterloo 200 committee, The War Horse Foundation is spearheading the project GREYS & GLORY. 

We are
Fritz Bronner, Director of the War Horse Foundation in Los Angeles, and Jonathan Findlay, former Captain of The Royal Scots
Dragoon Guards.

Our aim is to source enough riders, horses, period uniforms, logistical support and funds to guarantee the representation of The Royal Scots Greys on the original battlefield at the bicentennial commemorations and re-enactment at Waterloo in Belgium (17-21 June 2015).
While remembering the past, we wish to also recognise the present; after we have covered our logistical and administrative costs, surplus funds raised will go to our chosen charities: ABF The Soldiers' Charity and Scotty's Little Soldiers.
The Army Benevolent Fund (now The Soldiers' Charity) is a charity-trust that assists British veterans and their families. Scotty's Little Soldiers is a charity-trust focused on the children of military veterans who have fallen in their country's service.  These are  the equivalent of the Wounded Warriors and other like-minded VETERAN SUPPORT projects in America. This is a chance to help and say thank you for their service and sacrifice.

WHAT WE NEED
We hope to field up to 20 horses and riders on the day, but all their logistical and administrative costs need to be covered.
We hope to raise at least £150,000 (£5000 per horse and rider + taxes, charges and contingency) beyond which all surplus funds will benefit our chosen charities.
All donations, large or small, will bring us closer to achieving our goal and to helping our chosen charities.
There are also other ways in which you can help.
You can contribute more than money...
· Please get the word out, sound the trumpets and make some noise about our GREYS & GLORY campaign.
· Please use the Indiegogo share tools to share with your friends!
· If you have or know someone in the UK or Europe who has suitable, fit & trained, grey horses that can be loaned or lent to us, please let us know. 
· If you have some spare frequent flyer air-miles, these will help defray costs and assist in bringing the administrative team together for planning and coordination meetings and training sessions for the troops. 
· If you have British tack and saddles and can loan, lend or donate the gear to our campaign. 
· If you have ideas and suggestions, please contact us!
CORPORATE SPONSORSHIP
If you are part of a corporation and wish to help sponsor our campaign, we would be delighted to discuss our sponsorship solutions with you and will do our best to tailor the benefits to your budget and expectations. Please contact us via our website www.greysandglory.org. 
DONATIONS
Donations can be made via PayPal on this site. You don't however need a Paypal account.
Donations will be collected by The War Horse and Militaria Heritage Foundation and, after logistical and administrative costs have been covered, surplus funds will be paid to our chosen charities.  Donations by US citizens in the US are 100% tax- deductible to a 501-c3 non-profit that is fulfilling its educational mission.  The mission of the War Horse & Militaria Heritage Foundation (War Horse Foundation) is to educate the public of the contribution that horses have made in military history. 

For the past 15 years, War Horse Foundation has been presenting the GREYS in Parade Dress in California at festivals and cultural events, including four times in the Tournament of Roses Parade. 
Now, with THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS, we hope to  go to Waterloo and present the battle-campaign dress of the of the ROYAL SCOTS GREYS.  Some of our existing uniforms can be used, but others will need to be made from scratch, along with new gear and equipment and it all has to be shipped over to Belgium. PLEASE NOTE- we are not taking our horses over, due to expense and the stress this would cause to the horses.  We will therefore need to borrow or rent horses locally. 
With active and former officers of THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS and the support of the Regiment's Waterloo 200 Committee, we are all working together to build this project. 
Please take a moment or two to view the following series of videos we have prepared for this campaign. For those of you who wish to know more, additional information can also be found below or on our website www.greysandglory.org. THANK YOU FOR YOUR VALUABLE SUPPORT!
Warm regards,
Jonathan Findlay & Fritz Bronner

_______________________________________________________________________
A FEW WORDS.... From the Commanding Officer of THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS
"It is an honour to introduce GREYS & GLORY which commemorates the bicentenary of the Battle of Waterloo, at which our regimental forebears fought.....The re-enactment of the battle on the 200th anniversary, offers us an opportunity to continue this legacy....This momentous event that will see the charge of the GREYS alongside some five thousand international re-enactors cannot occur without the hard work, sponsorship and support of many. 
I earnestly request your support to this important effort. the logistical challenge is considerable but one that must embraced with vigour and enthusiasm.
Proceeds that are raised beyond the costs....will go to the ABF: The Soldier's Charity, who help thousands of beneficiaries whenever they are in need including those serving and their families."
- Lt Colonel Ben J. Cattermole MBE
  Commanding Officer, THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS

_______________________________________________________________________
The Royal Scots Dragoon Guards
Home Headquarters, The Castle, Edinburgh EHI 2YI 
October 2014 
I was commissioned into The Royal Scots Greys in 1965 on the 150th Anniversary of Waterloo -- now 50 years on, the importance of the Victory at the Battle of Waterloo is un-diminished. 
This coming year we commemorate the 200th Anniversary of The Battle of Waterloo. For our Regiment, now known as The Royal Scots Dragoon Guards, Waterloo remains our main Battle Honour and The Eagle of the 45th French Infantry is still proudly worn as our cap badge. The treasured Eagle Standard captured by Sergeant Ewart is displayed in our Edinburgh Castle Museum, reminding us all of that famous Charge of the Union Brigade and sadly the 189 Regimental Soldiers who bravely gave their lives for King and Country. Their extraordinary courage continues to inspire the modern day Troopers who willingly risk their lives in the interests of World Peace, in the many challenging operational situations of today. 
My Waterloo 200 Committee fully supports The GREYS & GLORY initiative championed by the War Horse Foundation, to pay formal tribute to those who fell at Waterloo. "
Brigadier Melville S. Jameson, Chairman Waterloo 200 Committee

____________________________________________________________________
"The Greys and Glory ride at Waterloo 200 should be a once in a lifetime opportunity to take recreate military history.  Profits from the ride will go towards charity.  ABF The Soldiers’ Charity (originally the Army Benevolent Fund, since creation in 1944) is the national charity of the British Army.  The charity looks after all soldiers, veterans (young and old) and their families when in need.  Our youngest beneficiary is a 5-month old child, the oldest a 107-year-old widow of a veteran.  Whether a soldier from World War Two, Korea, the Falklands, Northern Ireland, Iraq of Afghanistan (and many other campaigns besides), the Army’s charity provides the backbone of support typically to over 5000 individuals and families annually. No two families or situations are the same, but to those concerned the charity’s help can be little short of life-changing.  Poignantly, amongst these ranks are of course regimental descendants of Waterloo’s Scots Greys – today’s Royal Scots Dragoon Guards.
Thank you for your donation to Greys and Glory.  Any profits from the ride will go towards charity, which will allow us to help soldiers, veterans and families from World War Two to recent conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan.
Good luck to all the riders taking part at Waterloo 200!”
Charles Dunphie, Regional Director Scotland, ABF The Soldiers' Charity
______________________________________________________________________
WHERE WILL THE FUNDS BE SPENT?
Your support of Greys & Glory will help and assist us in finding suitable grey horses to participate at the Waterloo commemorations, manufacture additional uniforms and bearskins caps of the era, gauntlets, equipment and accoutrements for horse and rider.  
Some items we have in stock and needs fluffing and repairs while many others will need to be manufactured.  
Relive the charge of the Greys! 
The horses will need to be transported from around Western Europe to Belgium, cared for, fed and trained as a unit. 
We have ambitious goals and with your help we hope we can present up to 30 Royal Scots Greys as they were in 1815 and participate in the five days at Waterloo 200.


What We Need & What You Get
We need these funds to secure suitable grey horses from the local region of Scotland, England, Wales, France, Germany, Belgium and or Holland, to train, drill, and transport to Waterloo, Belgium.  These horses will be privately owned, loaned or rented. They will need medical clearances by Veterinarians with proper certification clearances to cross borders in order to be at Waterloo 2015. All of the horses will need to be transported to Waterloo several days before the event, boarded and cared for. Horses need constant support personnel to be exercised, groomed and trained. This support involves grooms and extra hands to make sure the horses are always safe.
For You as a Donor!
By contributing to GREYS & GLORY, we have some amazing and unique PERKS with special access to functions at the higher levels. Please explore our PERK LIST below for more details.
Two hundred years ago, individuals founded and funded cavalry regiments. Cavalry regiments were historically pricier than infantry regiments, and they still are today. Officers back then, purchased their rank, and these funds helped pay for the regiment. We are hoping that you can help raise the 1815 ROYAL SCOTS GREYS this same way. By your level of donation, you are "purchasing" your honorary rank as part of the 1815 ROYAL SCOTS GREYS.  Your name will be listed in the DONOR RANK LIST under your level of donation. The list will be displayed in highest rank to lowest rank. 


We will
be operating a Prize Draw, into which the names of all donors, received both on and off line and
including those who wish to remain anonymous, will be entered, however the Terms and Conditions of Indiegogo do not
allow for the details to be hosted on this campaign page. Please therefore refer to our website www.greysandglory.org for details.                                                                                               -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Impact YOU will make with your contribution.
Your contribution will make this campaign possible and help build 1815 era ROYAL SCOTS GREYS into a mounted unit, similar to how they were when they made their famous charge at Waterloo.  
This is the first time in history (200 years!) to see the 1815 ROYAL SCOTS GREYS thundering again on the battlefield of Waterloo! You will make this iconic image part commemoration, memorial, part visual poetry and recognition of this British cavalry charge.
US donations is 100% tax- deductible to a 501-c3 non-profit that is fulfilling its educational mission.  The War Horse & Militaria Heritage Foundation (War Horse Foundation) mission is to educate the public of the contribution that horses made in military history. 

Your contribution and assistance will rebuild the grandeur of the ROYAL SCOTS GREYS as a mounted cavalry unit again! 
Let's make Britain and Scotland proud by remembering the GREYS, and their noble deeds!
Veterans of the GREYS and THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS will be present, honoured and thanked at a commemoration.
It will be the first time in 200 years that the GREYS have been at Waterloo! 
This is a once in a lifetime campaign! The 200th Anniversary only comes once! Here is a chance to show this to the WORLD!
Your support will allow us to bring this noble British cavalry regiment back to the fields of Waterloo in front of hundreds of thousands of spectators for the first time!
The combination of THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS, retired members of the regiment and the War Horse Foundation, brings an experienced team together.
Surplus funds, will go to two wonderful charity-trusts benefiting military veterans and their families, that are in need.                                                                --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 


Risks & Challenges

How can we possibly rebuild a cavalry regiment from two hundred years ago?We have cavalry experience and many have military experience from their time in THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS along with discipline and training.  The War Horse Foundation has been presenting cavalry regiments and blending horses, riders and uniforms for 15 years. The Foundation has appeared in over 150 parades, as well as festivals, civic events and 25 schools.
All of the riders joining the GREYS & GLORY campaign, are experienced riders, however we plan to hold training days for the horses and riders to prepare for the event. 
War Horse trains every week as a mounted unit. Several of the former officers of THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS regularly ride and many have their own horses as well. Together, with our combined experience we should be able to quickly create a cohesive unit.
We will make our best efforts to achieve our goals, but if we do not have the full financial resources available, we will have to scale our scope of the  project. Other risks include weather, force-majeure or unforeseen obstacles or decisions made by the organisers of the event which could alter or curtail our plans. We also are working with horses that have natural inherent risks and potential unpredictable reactions to stimulus. All the donations are non refundable and will be spent on program costs with surplus amounts going to the designated charities.
This is a lifetime dream for many of us; to present and share the 1815 ROYAL SCOTS GREYS and commemorate the valour and sacrifice by this regiment at Waterloo. We are honoured to present the GREYS for the first time in 200 years at Waterloo and hopefully at events in the UK as well. 

How your donations will be applied.......The majority of the funds will go to finding quality grey horses, suitable for the ceremony, presentations and the battle reenactment at Waterloo. This includes rental of the horses, insurance, transportation, feed, box stalls, vet care, shoeing, grooms, health inspections, equine documentation, tack, equipment, shipping. We also need to cover the cost of tentage, food for the teams, travel, transportation of equipment , insurance and uniforms. We already have a dozen Scots Grey 1815 uniforms which we have been using for fifteen years. Some of these will need some refurbishing and we will need additional uniforms to ensure that all riders are kitted out. Additional bearskin caps, weather covers for bearskins, campaign breeches, accoutrements, extra bearskins, should straps and pouches. We also will have horse trailer transport trucks & drivers, ground crew and support team to take care of and their sustenance to cover.
All surplus funds, after administrative and logistical costs have been covered, will go 80% to ABF The Soldiers' Charity and 20%  Scotty's Little Soldiers.

FUNDING BREAKDOWN AVERAGE  

(above the BASE Tier 1 amount)

17%.    UNIFORMS & EQUIPMENT - manufacture, purchase, rentals & repairs
11%     PERSONNEL  - Rider, Crew, Drivers, transportation, insurance, sustenance

 9%.     ADMINISTRATION  - Fees, Overhead, Accounting, Hired Labour

  4%.     CONTINGENCY 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Who is Riding?
Several retired officers from the regiment, enthusiasts and a group from the War Horse Foundation. We recruit experienced riders who need to handle a variety of situations with horses. We have men and women regularly train and  ride in the troop. All of the women that ride with us, hide their gender to appear as male troopers; just as the famous Mother Ross did with the Scots Greys one hundred years before Waterloo. THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS are very proud of the history and heritage of Mother Ross's exploits in battle as a SCOTS GREY and proudly recognise her in the regimental histories. The Regiment also recognises the value of diversity in the military today and the  Mother Ross's that may serve in the military today and in the future.

The riders are mostly based in the US & UK, but several are living throughout Europe as well. There is a shared knowledge overlap of the training and skills needed for this campaign.

What if you do not raise the full amount? 
Any amount of funding will help us in our goals in even a small way. We are determined to go to Waterloo, even with just a small footprint. There has never been a SCOTS GREY riding on the fields of Waterloo since the famous battle... Ideally we can make a proper presentation, worthy of the accomplishments of the ROYAL SCOTS GREYS.  We have already spent hundreds of hours planning this journey and are determined to give honour to the regiment. 
Once we have covered our logistical and administrative costs, any remaining funds left over will go to ABF The Soldiers' Charity & Scotty's Little Soldiers.
_____________________________________________________________________________
- A message from Fritz
"The British have been our most valued friend and  ally, thru thick and thin... Here is a chance to recognise this by commemorating and celebrating the heritage of the GREYS for this auspicious ceremony and helping out British veterans and their families. All surplus funds will go to the ABF The Soldiers' Charity and Scotty's Little Soldiers.
This is a fantastic program for veterans and their families... Here is a chance for Americans to say thank you!
I can not tell you how much of a privilege and honour it is to be part of this endeavour. It is a once in a life time experience and we are hoping you will join and help us with any size of donation. Through your support we can take this journey together as we post images, videos and accounts of this fantastic series of commemorations of the ROYAL SCOTS GREYS."-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- A message from Jonathan



"I served in the Regiment over 20 years ago, as a Captain and Squadron Second-in-Command. And what an amazing Regiment in which to serve! Scotland's senior Regiment; Scotland's only cavalry Regiment; the Regiment's Colonel-in-Chief is none other than Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II; the Regiment boasts one of the most impressive lists of battle honours of all British Regiments; even the Pipes and Drums of The Royal Scots Dragoon Guards have achieved worldwide fame, winning numerous awards and holding the N°1 spot in the UK music charts for weeks on end! Everything about the Regiment breathes professionalism, courage, tradition and accomplishment. It truly is a Regiment which is Second to None.
However, you would have thought that, with so many accolades, the Regiment could afford to field its own troops at the Waterloo reenactment, but this is sadly not the case. The Regiment may have been one of the lucky few to have survived the recent volley of amalgamations and disbandments, but it has been equally hit by the cut-backs, both in terms of budget and autonomy. The World is getting smaller and the changing threat calls for changing roles and tactics. Already the Regiment is downsizing from Challenger II tanks to light armoured vehicles and there is no guarantee that The Royal Scots Dragoon Guards will remain untouched and intact should another round of defence cuts scythe through centuries of history and tradition. Ironically, the Regiment's conversion to lighter vehicles and its move back to Scotland both coincide with the bicentenary of Waterloo, the Regiment's most famous battle honour – another reason why the Regiment is counting upon us to represent The Greys at the Waterloo in 2015. And we are counting upon you to help us make it happen!Greys and Glory is much more than just a handful of riders dressing up and playing soldiers for a day or two. It is the opportunity to showcase the Regiment at a key moment in its history, to educate the audience and to pay tribute to those who courageously and selflessly risked their lives on the battlefield, many of whom paid the ultimate price. 


My ancestor, James Wemyss, led his troop in the final charge of the Greys at Waterloo. Wounded in the arm and having taken musket fire and had two horses shot from beneath him, he wrote a letter from the battlefield to his sisters in Edinburgh, informing them of the victory and of the severe losses suffered by the Regiment. Of the initial 400 cavalry, he writes that only 26 remained on the field to the last. This may be close to the figure we manage to field on the day. Admittedly a lot less than the original 400, but at least it will be something. In fact, it will be more than something – it will be a major accomplishment! 
The Greys not being represented at the bicentenary re-enactment is unimaginable. It is a once in a lifetime opportunity. Please help us to make it happen!"

 
Other Ways You Can Help
You can contribute more than money...

Please get the word out, sound the trumpets and make some noise about our GREYS & GLORY campaign.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools to share with your friends!
If you have or know someone in the UK or Europe who has suitable, fit & trained,  grey horses that can be loaned to us, please let us know. 
If you have frequent flyer airline  miles,  this will help defray costs and  assist in bringing the administrative team together for planning and coordination meetings and training sessions for the troops. 
If you have British tack and saddles and can loan or donate the gear to our campaign. 
If you have ideas and suggestions, please contact us!

CORPORATE SPONSORSHIP
If you are part of a corporation and wish to help sponsor our campaign, we have a special corporate marketing package we would like to send you and would be delighted to discuss details, benefits and the level of sponsorship. Please contact us via our website www.greysandglory.org. 

WATERLOO - the 1970s film. The impressive film footage you are seeing is from the 1970s film, WATERLOO, staring Rod Steigert & Christopher Plummer.  With the producers heirs' gracious permission and in association with THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS, we can give you an impression of what THE ROYAL SCOTS GREYS would have looked like. While greatly appreciated and entertaining to watch this charge, there are some inaccuracies and inconsistencies of The GREYS' charge as it was presented in the film, and this will give us the chance to educate at WATERLOO 2015 by sharing the the actual details of what really happened two hundred years ago. 
The GREYS and the UNION BRIGADE actually charged, a massive column of thousands  of French infantry.  The French suffered hundreds if casualties and two-three thousand were captured as prisoners. This clash of cavalry and infantry would have proved far too costly for the movie production,  so it was dropped completely. During the charge many  of the GREYS probably wore weather covers on their bearskins. The GREYS continued the charge and successfully overran the French artillery. The GREYS also completed  four or five additional charges later that day which contributed to the attrition of both troopers and horses.  None of this was covered in the film nor is it ever mentioned in most historical books. 


PERKS

We have designed some unique GREYS & GLORY  donation gifts for you and for your kind support!

REFRIGERATOR MAGNET -  Shades of Greys is our first design. We will have several additional designs and will announce this on our blog in the near future.
BOOKMARK -  Share the passion of the GREYS & GLORY Campaign. 
POSTCARD - CARD , There will be several designs and it will either be a postcard or a card w/ envelope, (photo shows card with envelope)
POSTER - We will have several designs of posters of artwork of the 1815 GREYS.
COFFEE MUG - TEA MUG - we have several designs of 1815 era SCOTS GREYS for your support and enjoyment
CANVAS ART PRINT, signed by the digital artist. We have several beautiful art canvas prints of the 1815 era SCOTS GREYS.  These are unique gifts designed for this campaign and your support. 
LONG SLEEVE SHIRT- This comes in one size, LARGE.  It will display proudly the 1815 SCOTS GREYS and the GREYS & GLORY CAMPAIGN.  Wear it proud and show your support!
COFFEE TABLE BOOK - This is a War Horse Foundation, Coffee Table book sharing the history of the horse in war. It displays many famous cavalry regiments, including THE ROYAL SCOTS GREYS.
1815 ROYAL SCOTS GREY PLUSH TOY - This is a unique one of a kind soft toy of a trooper and grey horse, ready to be named and displayed in your home and to share with youngsters. 
KEY FOB - This will be a GREYS & GLORY designed Key Fob to share the memories of The GREYS for years to come.
SCOTS GREY, TROOPER'S FORAGE CAP (Reproduction)- This is a Trooper's Cap designed for camp life, worn the night before the battle. This will come in one size, for an adult, approximately size 58-59, or US 7 to 7- 1/4.
SCOTS GREY OFFICER BICORN HAT (Reproduction) - This is an Officer's Bicorn Hat, worn for all duties and carrying the rank of a senior officer in the 1815 era. This will come in one size, for an adult, being approximately 58-59, 7 to  7-1/4.
CRYSTAL DECANTER - Special Edition Gift Items commissioned by The Royal Scots Dragoon Guards to commemorate the Waterloo Bicentenary and The Greys.













STRETCH GOALS -------
This campaign of GREYS & GLORY is really Phase Two of the funding needed. 
If we can reach these funds now, on this campaign, it will allow us to have two troops or more! 
If we can obtain these stretch goals now, it will allow better efficiency of the funds, especially in procuring the horses on a group rate and with transportation along with deposits etc. 
Most importantly, the more funds we raise, the higher the percentage that also goes to ABF The Soldiers' Charity & Scotty's Little Soldiers.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Bicentenary Re-enactment and Commemorations are in full preparation and the organisers have launched a number of trailers and teaser videos:


Thank you for your interest and visiting our campaign and we hope with your contribution, you can raise a glass and help raise a troop, a troop of SCOTS GREYS!

LINKS to visit and learn more about our GREYS & GLORY campaign, and more!
Our campaign website. Please visit us and learn more about the project and other plans we have!

The administrative committee that oversees the Edinburgh Waterloo 200 Committee www.waterloo200.org
The website for the Waterloo 2015 Commemoration.                                        www.waterloo2015.org

If we have not listed all names , it is only because we do not have your name and apologize for this oversight. Please contact us and we will make our best efforts to correct this.

"Scotland the Brave" by The Pipes & Drums of THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS
"The Gael" by The Pipes & Drums of THE ROYAL SCOTS DRAGOON GUARDS

story:
Short Summary

I am a playwright who is passionate about sharing uplifting stories that inspire the human spirit.  This project is near and dear to my heart.  I wrote the original book, however the music is set to an iconic singer that we all know and love.  The combination of iconic music, a very heartfelt storyline, an incredibly diverse cast, and an amazing universal message is what makes this NEW musical so magical!  

This musical has it all, including comedy and laughter, a hilarity that is sparked by 6 of the supporting characters who are (LGBT) drag queens/transgender prostitutes, an African American lead cast, female-based subject matter, and a little girl named "Butterfly" who will melt your heart and reignite your childlike spirit.

This powerful story is told through uplifting music and dance, including 16 spirited songs, set to the music of a disco icon, and re-orchestrated for the stage.  The story reminds us that the friendships we find along the way, to illuminate our journey, support and guide us, are sometimes found in the unlikeliest of places.   It is a beautiful and magical story about reclaiming and embracing our inner spirit, loving and believing in ourselves, and the transformation we undergo when we free ourselves from the judgment and expectations of others.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $20k in funding to help give this musical wings to fly!  Butterfly wings that is....  Your contribution will go directly to the following:

  • Clearing the musical rights and legal fees
  • Preproduction for the Preview of the show that is slated for 2015-16 in Boston and/or Provincetown; Some of the pre-production costs include a deposit on a venue, casting & auditions, rehearsal space, hiring a composer to reorchestrate the music, and hiring and organizing a production crew, as well as early wardrobe/costuming and scenic design plans.
Your contribution is INCREDIBLY VALUABLE.  Perks that you will receive include top billing, credits, and thank you mentions in the Preview show's Program, as well as free advertising, social media mentions, photo opportunities with the cast and crew, autographed scripts, artwork, VIP & General Admission tickets to the Preview, and MORE!

The Impact

In addition to being a playwright, producer, director and choreographer, I have been a marketing and PR guru for many years, owning an agency that catered to arts and entertainment clients.  I know business.  I know art.  I understand how to make projects successful, from start to finish.  I have never put on a show, concert, production, or event that hasn't been a smashing success.  Your contribution will give this project the foundation that it needs to build a workshop/preview (full production) and attract media, producers, theatre owners, investors, and more.  This is crucial in order to get the show to the next phase and share it with the world!  The nature of the music is such that this show has the potential of being not only a national commercial successs, but especially an interntional hit!  But first, we must start small.  We must get the work up on stage, bring the characters and storyline to life, and showcase the magic of this amazing musical!

Risks & Challenges

To minimize risks and challenges, I have assembled a combination of savvy people working for me and collaborating with me, who are the top in their field, including clearance people, entertainment lawyers, and theatrical consultants... Working with these trusted folks really helps ease the process and ensure there are few stumbling blocks.  We are positioned well to move forward with the rights and developmental production.  Green lights are ahead!

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way to help is to be in the know about the production but to keep it quiet... shhhhhhhhhh!  You're in on a secret!... The early stages of a very special project that will honor the music of a cultural icon and not only revive the music but also give it a new story line & context and reinspire its popularity.  Although we can't reveal all of the details just yet, we can share with you the magic of the story and have you support the project's journey.  Thank you in advance for your support!

story:
About Unspoken Acts

When loner Dale befriends Father Frank in confession, an extraordinary journey begins. Dale confides his deepest regrets and darkest secrets. Moved by Dale's lifelong suffering, Father Frank vows to clear Dale's name, putting his own faith and position at risk and facing an old lesson: Trust is a gift from God.

The powerful and moving Ariel Eliaz brings to life the world of Dale and Father Frank in this gripping and emotional tale of a brother's love and the mission to save a fellow man. Taking place over a two year period, one sees the inner turmoil of a person which has the wisdom and power to speak of the Unspoken Acts.


Unspoken Acts’ Production History

Unspoken Acts was originally a play that was written by Coni Koepfinger for six players and published in 2005.  In the fall of 2014 Josh Parkin-Ring approached Coni to rewrite the play to work for one Actor.  Josh then approached Ariel Eliaz, of who he has been searching for the right piece for, and Ariel agreed to bring this challenging but tastefully written story to life.  Lastly, Josh has been searching for the right piece to work with the brilliant Stage Director Melissa Attebery and brought her into the mix in early 2015.


What We Need & What you get as a Contributor

The live theater experience is one that nothing can replace.  As a contributor you are making this sought-out unique experience happen.  Below is a list of things your contribution can provide for us and the benefits for you!

What we need are: $2500 for salaries of the professionals working their hardest on this project, $1500 for estimated production fees and royalties, and $1000 for marketing, scenic and other production needs.  


What you get: the great feeling of supporting live independent theater in New York City--the artisitc endevour of many creatives.  Depending on what level you have contributed at we have some exciting gifts for your generous support

  • $2500+  Name Above the Title Club!  This exclusive club understands the importance of live theater in today’s society and has the means to support the on going creatives in the industry.  A patron which contributes the amount of $2500 or is reserving their name to be published above the title in association with the Producer, guaranteed tickets for two people at every public performance, and all of the gifts from other contribution levels.
  • $1,000+ Hanging Out with Creatives Club! This club is a generous type and they want to see what happens behind the scenes.  A patron which contributes at this level will opening night tickets for himself and up to five friends, a special meet and greet with the cast and creatives, a signed poster and a special thank you letter.  Along with the other gifts from the lower contribution levels will be able to privately book additional tickets at a reduced fee to additional performances.
  • $500.00+ The New York Theatre Club! New Yorkers know how to put on a show!  This very popular club allows the patron to invite up to three friends on opening night and will receive a personalized program signed by the entire company and all of the lower contribution level gifts.
  • $100.00+ The New York City Theatre Goers! Without this energetic and quick witted group of people theatre would not survive.  A patron who contributed at this level will receive two opening night tickets and their name(s) mentioned in the program along with a very special thank you.
  • $25.00+  The Starving Artists Club! We have all been there or are still there.  The patron contributing at this level will receive one voucher good for one ticket to a performance other than opening night.  Their name will be listed in the program.
  • $5+  The Supporters! Thank you for your support!


Can’t financially contribute?

As some of us cannot contribute we would please ask that you spread the word about our fundraising efforts, look us up on social media and of course buy a ticket to see this amazing work!  No contribution of time, materials or money is ever too small.  Simple email encouraging the team can make a grey sky turn blue!


If we don’t first succeed...

Try it again!  As with every crowd-sourcing endeavour we may not make our goal.  If you’re contributing to this amazing campaign please rest assured your contribution will be kept safe for Unspoken Acts.  Our team is very committed to capitalizing this groundbreaking piece and will continue to fundraising until our funding goals are met.  

Some of this risks that we do foresee is the cost of production may increase in the ever changing economy, whole-hearted ecstatic contributors sometimes are not able to contribute their entire pledge, fees and other expenses do come-up time-to-time.  As we all understand, these are the risks of producing live independent theater in New York City.  But rest assured, If we don’t first succeed, we will try again!


The Impact

Why would you want to support this amazing piece of American Theatre?  Because we all have a story.  We all can change the World.  No matter how little or how big the lessons learned or the strength passed on by the struggles of another are priceless.  In Unspoken Acts, Father Frank has a life changing decision to make.  Loose everything and stand up for what is right or just be a passer by and allow a man to die.  Which would you choose?


The Team

Ariel Eliaz (Performer) Received Best of Festival for his performance in Boiled Alive! At The Player’s Theatre in New York City. He also received a TANYS (Theater Association of New York State) Award for his portrayal of The Cat in the Hat in Seussical the Musical. Other roles include: John Proctor in The Crucible; Tom Wingfield in The Glass Menagerie; James Bates in Book of Days; Lenny Ganz in Rumors; Charlie Brown in You’re a Good Man Charlie Brown; Pseudolus in A Funny Thing Happened On The Way To The Forum; and Ali Hakim in Oklahoma.

Melissa Attebery (Director) began in Los Angeles in series television, holding various positions in production and development at companies like Paramount, Viacom and Granada Entertainment before moving to the New York stage.

Her New York stage credits include primarily original works, playing at venues such as Primary Stages, The Abingdon, HERE, Queens Theatre in the Park, FringeNYC, The Players, TADA and at Westbeth. She assistant-directed for Tina Howe at the 24 Hour Plays on Broadway and directed the award-winning comedy Larry Gets the Call by Matt Casarino (The 15-Minute Play Festival), which went on to be featured at DaDaFest International in Liverpool, where she also directed other original works, including Screw You Jimmy Choo!, her production of which originally premiered at the Gasworks Arts Park in Melbourne, Australia, then at the Kennedy Center.

She produced A Celebration of Women in Theatre: Miss Representation, a rousing and thought-provoking evening of film, theatre, photography and discussion at The Players; and she is a co-producer and director with On Her Shoulders (onhershoulders.weebly.com), which works to reveal, from centuries past, the great tradition and contribution of female playwrights to the theatrical canon.

She has evaluated scripts for the Atlantic Theater Company, New York Theatre Workshop and FringeNYC, and she holds both a BA in Dramatic Art and Film Studies from UC Santa Barbara and an MFA in Directing from the Actors Studio Drama School. She is the Associate Artistic Director and a resident director at Emerging Artists Theatre, a member of The Actors Studio Playwright/Director Workshop and the League of Professional Theatre Women and an Associate Member of the SDC. For updates on Melissa’s upcoming projects, please visit www.melissaattebery.com.


Coni Koepfinger (Playwright) is an internationally published and produced playwright and is the Associate Director / Playwright-in-Residence of NYC’s Spiral Studio Theatre. In addition to a long career teaching college theatre and composition at Carnegie Mellon, Point Park, Penn State and other universities, Koepfinger is on the Board of ICWP, the Media / Arts Advisory Board of Lifeboat Foundation, a Member of The Dramatists Guild, Theatre Without Borders, the National Italian American Foundation and the thinktank of the League of Professional Theatre Women.  Recent work includes a fresh look at political corruption in the face of Celtic mythology in  The Eve of Beltane, her new collaboration with Joe Izen: Turbulence commissioned by Mara Mills at Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Arts; and her metadrama Sideshow directed by Paul Navarra at Manhattan Repertory Theatre that takes gender, ego and identity struggles to a new dimension.


Josh Parkin-Ring (Producer) is the Managing Partner of JPR Omni Interests, an integrated entertainment agency that specializes in small to moderate productions with an emphasis on development, promotion and performance. JPR Omni has four divisions in sixteen markets across the United States, Canada and Europe. JPR Omni New York has represented talent such as Anita Gillette, Andromeda Turre, Cher, Mary J Blige, SONY Music and Macy's Parade and Entertainment Group to name a few.To date, Mr. Parkin has over 250 entertainment credits in various capacities. In 2008, he returned to the membership of Actors’ Equity Association as a Stage Manager for Seussical and continued onto Broadway’s Legally Blonde and Rock of Ages. After interning for Universal Pictures during the San Francisco workshop and preview of Wicked. He returned to Florida to work on Busch Garden Tampa Bay’s award-winning and critically acclaimed KaTonga produced by Town Square Productions and Busch Entertainment Corporation.Mr. Parkin returns annually to the New York Musical Theatre Festival, FringeNYC Festival, DreamUp Fest!, and Midtown Theater Festival as a Production Stage Manager. He also provides general management support for several developmental theatricals.Since 2013 Mr. Parkin is one of the senior captains for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade which is televised worldwide every November--a childhood dream.From 2001 until 2008 he was the controlling partner of the 10,000 sq.ft Metropolis-Matrix-Zodiac, Inc. in Orlando, Florida. This state-of-the-art nightclub complex hosted theme parties four nights a week entertaining up to 3,600 patrons. The complex also hosted many award-winning corporate events from the nearby Orange County Convention Center.He continues to work with several event and party promoters to produce Gay Days Orlando, Divas Live! and Divas Live Tour and special events nationwide and internationally.

story:
The Kagools is a 50 minute physical comedy show. Through sketches, audience participation and interactive multimedia, we see a glimpse into an enchanting, playful and hilarious world inhabited by two non speaking other worldy characters - The Kagools.

In 2015 we want to take the show to bigger audiences through various Fringe and comedy festivals including the world famous Edinburgh Fringe for the full month run. Venues, marketing, promotion and technical assistance will cost a huge amount as we expand this year, so we need your help!


"THE KAGOOLS IS ENCHANTING, BOLD, HIGH-ENERGY FUN FOR THE WHOLE FAMILY TO ENJOY."

The Kagools were created by comedy double-act Wilkinson Ford, starting life as recurring characters in their full-length sketch shows.

The Kagools proved so popular with audiences that in 2013 they started developing a full-length show featuring the characters. Their first show Kagoolio debuted in 2014 with a full run at the Edinburgh Fringe. The show was so well received that the duo have decided to focus on developing The Kagools further and are currently looking for touring opportunities to take the characters to a wider audience.

“It feels like a natural progression for us, and the great thing about The Kagools is that the comedy is universal. Whatever language you speak and however young or old you are, you can follow along and feel a part of the ridiculous mess The Kagools get themselves into.”

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our page. You can read a couple of reviews below.


★★★★★ – Audience Review

Kagoolio is the perfect show for anyone that enjoys an hour of silliness. The use of film and music was a great choice, and both performers found hilarious moments of comedy with audience members, both children and adults. Although bonkers, this show tells a charming story, which unfolds gleefully and left the room in joyful giggles. The only shame was that the audience was relatively small, and this show can be so much more with a bigger crowd. These girls deserve an audience. See it!!


★★★★ – Broadway Baby

Wilkinson Ford is the collective machination of Nicola Wilkinson and Claire Ford, combining their twin talents as actresses and comedians in an enchanting sketch comedy, Kagoolio.

Following in the hallowed tradition of Rowan Atkinson’s Mr Bean, we are treated to a cocktail of frenetic, characterful and ridiculous mime sketch. Not a single word is spoken throughout the entire performance. The pair (The Kagools) go on adventures together, dance together, try to one-up one another, and inculcate hapless audience members into their schemes. Despite most people’s reluctance to participate in a show normally, the warmth and friendliness that these two convey establishes trust with the audience very quickly. They deliver a playful and poignant performance.

Together the pair have a picnic, undertake an epic chase, reinvent an 80’s disco, compete for treats and create an excellent tableaux out of people. Much of the narrative is conveyed through their wonderful facial expressions. These two are masterful physical theatre performers. Moreover, the duo make excellent use of a projector screen, incorporating it into their performance in a very clever and perfectly timed way that I will not reveal to you here. It is a clear testament to hours of rehearsal and careful choreography.

The only minor setback is perhaps the discontinuity between some of the sketches; one character might be mad with envy as an audience member appears to favour the other performer, then suddenly drops that motivation completely as they move on to another sketch. It discombobulates the story a little bit. But this really is only a minor setback to an otherwise mesmerising performance.

These two are an absolute delight. It is a rare treat to see such skilful performers at work. This is an upbeat, engaging and hilarious performance. Kids and adults alike will love this excellent and interactive piece of theatre. It is an utterly delightful and thoroughly silly piece of sketch comedy.

story:
Independent Theatre at its Independentest! 

This is a brand new one-act penned by Dianna Tucker Baritot, a playwright living in Nassau County, Long Island.  In this charming tale, we meet two young Mets fans whose love and loyalty for one another grow ever deeper through the fervor of baseball fandom, alongside the absurdity of baseball's evolution over the course of 50 years, from 1986 to 2036.

What We Need

For its premiere, we want to give this show a professional production quality; your contribution can help make that possible!  While the cast is small and the set is minimal, we will need to pay for rehearsal space, props, and technical equipment, as well as photography and recording services.  The more we can raise, the better the production will be, and you can help make that happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it.  You aren't made of money.  (Boy, do we get it.)  Even if you can't make a monetary contribution, we need you!  We will need plenty of volunteers and borrowed/donated items.  Please contact Dianna Tucker Baritot for further information by clicking the link below:

http://diannatbaritot.bravesites.com/contact-me
